infotexts.entitydescription.eyeglasses: When worn, helps you a little with vision. (Disables the blurred vision affliction.)
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes: Right out of a human's skull. Used for transplants.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_monste: Right out of a monster's skull. Not great for seeing things, but useful in crafting.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_husk: Right out of a husk's skull. Cannot be damaged by water, improves your skills, and has a small chance to give you husk infection.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_bionic: A metal, much more resistant eye, made for transplantation. Improves vision quality.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_night: A pair of eyes, but with night vision cameras implanted.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_infrar: A pair of eyes, but with infrared cameras implanted. Slightly improves skill.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_plasti: A pair of "eyes" Not much better than being blind. While you can barely see with them, at least they're relatively cheap to make.
infotexts.entitydescription.muscleconnectors: Used in eye transplants. Use before putting in the eye, along with eye gel.
infotexts.entitydescription.eyedrops: Use on the eyes to make them heal a bit quicker.
infotexts.entitydescription.eyegel: Used in eye transplants. Use before putting in the eye, along with muscle connectors.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.noeye: The patient's eyes are gone, with empty, red holes being there instead.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyedamage: The patient's eyes look flat, and they have trouble seeing.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyeshock: The patient's immune system did not accept the eye, and it is attacking it instead. Eye removal is required to stop it.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyedrop: The patient's eye healing rate has increased. Caused by eye drops.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyemuscle: The muscle connectors are ready. Hurry!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyegell: The eye gel is ready. Hurry!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyelid: The eyelids are held up. Hurry!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyeone: The patient has lost all vision in one of the eyes.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyesickness: The patient has trouble seeing, because of the recent eye transplant. This should clear itself up in a matter of minutes.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyecataract: The patient's eyes look cloudy, and their vision is blurred. Eye surgery recommended
